isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - MIRRORS - HEATED, LIGHTED AND POWER

svcsubproc.title: Mirrors Heated Only
svcsubproc.para: Voltage is present at (J1) junction block, circuit 14P, circuit 14N, fuse block, fuse F34, and circuit 78A going to heated mirror relay (102). When key switch (24) is moved to the ignition or accessory position, voltage is present at circuit 12, (J2) junction block, circuit 12B, fuse F19 and circuit 78 going to heated mirror switch (101). With power windows, voltage is also present on circuit 83B which feeds circuit 83A going to the power windows. When the heated mirror switch (101) is moved to the on position, power flows through its indicator lamp to ground on circuits 78-GB and 78-GA causing it to illuminate. Power also flows through circuit 78B, the heated mirror relay coil (102), and ground circuits 78-GE and 78-GA to cab ground.

With the heated mirror relay (102) now energized, power flows through the relay contacts, through circuit 78C, connector (103), circuit 78C, circuit 78C1, connector (104), the green wire and connector (105) [connector (113) with power mirrors] to the left heated mirror. Its ground path is through connector (105) [connector (113) with power mirrors], the white wire, connector (104), circuits 78GC1, 78-GC, connector (103A) and circuit 78-GC to cab ground.

Power also flows through circuit 78C, connector (103B), circuit 78C, circuit 78C2, connector (124)/(104), the green wire and connector (105) to the left heated convex mirror. Its ground path is through connector (105), the white wire, connector (104)/(124), circuit 78-GC2, 78-GC, connector (103A), and circuit 78-GC to cab ground.

With the heated mirror relay energized, power also flows through circuit 78D, connector (106), circuits 78-D, 78-D1, connector (107), the green wire, and connector (108) [(113) with power mirrors] to the right heated mirror. Its ground path is through connector (108) [(113) with power mirrors], the white wire, connector (107), circuits 78-GD1, 78-GD, connector (106), circuits 78-GD, 78-GE and 78-GA to cab ground.

Power also flows through circuit 78D, connector (106), circuit 78-D/78-D2, connector (125)/(107), the green wire, and connector (108) to the right heated convex mirror. Its ground path is through conn. (108), the white wire, connector (107)/(125), circuits 78-GD2, 78-GD, connector (106), circuits 78-GD, 78-GE and 78-GA to cab ground.

svcsubproc.title: Mirrors Heated With Power
svcsubproc.para: Voltage is present at (J1) junction block, circuit 14P, circuit 14N, fuse block, fuse F34, and circuit 78L going to power mirror switch (111). When the switch is moved in one direction, current flows through switch (111) contacts, circuit 78K, connector (109), circuit 78K, connector (110), the red wire, and conn. (113) to power mirror motor. This causes it to move in one direction. The ground path, while the switch is in this position, is through connector (113), black wire, conn. (110), circuit 78J, conn. (109), circuit 78J, power mirror switch (111), circuits 78-GF, 78-GB, and 78-GA to cab ground.

When the switch is moved to the other position, current flows through the switch (111) contacts, circuit 78J, connector (109), circuit 78J, connector (110), black wire, and connector (113) to power mirror motor. This causes it to move in the direction opposite of that explained above. The ground path, while the switch is in this position, is through connector (113), red wire, connector (110), circuit 78K, connector (109), circuit 78K, power mirror switch (111), circuits 78-GF, 78-GB, and 78-GA to cab ground.

svcsubproc.title: Mirrors Lighted
svcsubproc.para: Voltage is present at circuit relay (R2) from junction block (J1), circuit 14R, circuit 14A, fuse F8, and circuit 58. When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the park or headlight position, power flows from junction block (J1) through circuit 14R, circuit 14E, fuse F24, circuit 50A, headlight switch (35) contacts, and circuit 58A to energize the coil of relay (R2). The ground path for relay (R2) is circuit 58-GA, connector (202), and white wire to cab ground. For vehicles with light interrupt switch, the ground path is circuit 58-G, interrupt switch (32), circuits 58-GB, 11-GA, and 11-GF to cab ground in the engine compartment.
With relay (R2) energized, power flows through the relay contacts, circuits 58B, 58C, 1/2 of connector (19), 1/2 of connector (121) and circuit 58C to a splice.

From the splice current flows through circuit 58J, connector (103), circuit 78N and connector (255) to left mirror light. The ground path is through connector (105), the white wire, connector (104), circuits 78-GC1, 78-GC, connector (103) and circuit 78-GC to cab ground.

From the splice current flows through circuit 58K, connector (106), circuit 78M, connector (254), the yellow wire and connector (108) [or connector (113) with power mirrors] to right mirror light. The ground path is through connector (108) [or connector (113) with power mirrors], the white wire, connector (107), circuits 78-GD1, 78-GD, connector (106), circuits 78-GD, 78-GE, and 78-GA to cab ground.
